data.title: Documentation Fixes
data.body:
This PR adds a bunch of documentation fixes.
- Cleanup of Welcome message.
- Fixed bad list in custom effects page.
- Added latest SharpDoc with lots of formatting fixes for MonoGame.
  - [Support for `<paramref>`](https://github.com/xoofx/SharpDoc/pull/15).
  - [Fixed links for out types](https://github.com/xoofx/SharpDoc/pull/17).
  - [Fixed links to topic pages](https://github.com/xoofx/SharpDoc/pull/14)
  - [Various Markdown conversion fixes](https://github.com/xoofx/SharpDoc/pull/16)

data.title: A lot of Texture2D allocation garbage collector problem
data.body: http://community.monogame.net/t/a-lot-of-texture2d-allocation-garbage-collector-problem/939

data.title: Iterating TouchCollection creates garbage
data.body: Full details in this post, along with the discussion in the comment section of the answer, which concluded with a request for me to submit the issue here. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/25146131/iterating-touchcollection-creates-garbage

data.title: ProcessorParameters not using InvariantCulture
data.body:
Importing the ProcessorParameters was the last place the InvariantCulture was not being used, resulting in errors if the user's local culture used a comma for a decimal separator.

Fixes #2923

data.title: Character map could be unsorted and glyphs sorted
data.body:
The character regions in a spritefont file could be specified in any order. The FontDescription.Characters list would remain in this unsorted order. After glyphs were imported, the glyphs list was sorted based on Glyph.Character.  The SpriteFontContent had already copied the unsorted character list.

The fix is not copy the character list when creating the SpriteFontContent and populate it from the sorted glyph list when all other glyph information is added to the SpriteFontContent.

Fixes #2924

data.title: Pipeline tool font issue: non-latin characters have wrong encoding
data.body:
The same issue on Windows Phone 8 and iOS platform.

.spritefont file example:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<XnaContent xmlns:Graphics="Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics">
  <Asset Type="Graphics:FontDescription">
    <FontName>Arial</FontName>
    <Size>30</Size>
    <Spacing>0</Spacing>
    <UseKerning>true</UseKerning>
    <Style>Bold</Style>
    <CharacterRegions>
      <CharacterRegion>
        <Start> </Start>
        <End>~</End>
      </CharacterRegion>
      <CharacterRegion>
        <Start>А</Start>
        <End>я</End>
      </CharacterRegion>
      <CharacterRegion>
        <Start>Ё</Start>
        <End>Ё</End>
      </CharacterRegion>
      <CharacterRegion>
        <Start>ё</Start>
        <End>ё</End>
      </CharacterRegion>
    </CharacterRegions>
  </Asset>
</XnaContent>
```

data.title: Pipeline tool Value cannot be converted to Single
data.body:
Hello everyone,

I ma trying to build my game content with the pipeline tool. Sadly some of my models need to be scaled by 0.042 which the pipeline tool fails to accept when I import the XNA content project. It always says the value cannot be converted to Single.

Thanks a lot,
Christian

data.title: Test and fix for null reference error when empty constructing a TouchCollection
data.body:
It is either this or adding a `_collection != null` check to each method that accesses `_collection`.
Can change to the null check if you think that'd be nicer.

Fixes #2898

data.title: Pipeline history support iso storage
TargetPlatform.WindowsGL
data.body: This adds `TargetPlatform.WindowsGL` as a platform.  This makes it easier to build content for WindowsGL platform which is separate from `TargetPlatform.Windows`.

data.title: Dependencies Update
data.body:
Updated to latest dependencies.
- CppSharp
- Mac FreeType
- XWT-Mac
- OpenTK fixes.

data.title: Changed MGEffectProcessor to build DirectX_11 if platform is Windows
data.body: Currently, building using the monogame content pipeline produces OpenGL shaders when targeting Windows which fail at run time.  This fix changes the processor to build DX11 shader effects when targeting Windows.

data.title: Docs for Point,Point.ToVector2,Small unification comment fixes for Color
data.body: Now, I think its correct. @KonajuGames what do you think ?

data.title: GraphicsDevice.SetRenderTarget(null) appears broken on Windows?
data.body:
I stumbled across this while moving a test project I wrote on Linux to Windows.  GraphicsDevice.SetRenderTarget(null) should set the render target back to the device backbuffer (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb198872(v=xnagamestudio.31).aspx), but it does not appear to be working correctly - only on Windows.  

Here are the results I've seen in some quick tests after adding the SetRenderTarget(null) to a newly created default XNA and Monogame projects.  I never really set the render target to anything else, just added the null call before the default cornflower clear:

With...
- Xna on Windows:  Window Draws fine.
- MonoGame on Windows: Window Draws fine.
- FNA/MonoGame-SDL on Windows:  Window is not drawn - ends up transparent or white.
- FNA/Monogame-SDL on Linux:  Window Draws fine.

I've not had time to investigate whether this is a FNA issue, or if it's just bringing out an underlying SDL2 problem.

-J

data.title: Effect Sampler is Destroying Texture2D
data.body: Details are posted in the forum post: http://community.monogame.net/t/repro-project-monogame-destroying-sampler-texture/941 When the effect sampler is set, MonoGame is destroying the source texture unexpectedly. Before the sampler is set the spotted texture appears: After the samplers texture is set, the texture turns black: Expected result would be the third texture should change while the first two would remain unaffected. ``` // PROBLEM: *** GraphicsDevice.Textures[1] = _light; // some how the _light Texture2D is being disposed when this is set _lightingEffect.Parameters["LightSampler"].SetValue(_light); // this also causes the _light texture2D to be disposed ``` Repro project included: http://tagenigma.com/monogame/ExampleScreenEffect.zip

data.title: The MonoGame Documentation doesn't render properly in Firefox
data.body:
I just had a friend notice that the MonoGame documentation web pages don't render properly in Firefox.

I have confirmed this on my own machine running Firefox 23.0.1

data.title: Some links on website do not navigate to relevant pages
data.body:
To reproduce:
- Go to http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=Adding_Art_Sounds_and_More
- Click the "Using the Pipeline Tool" and/or "Custom Effects" links.

_What should happen:_
The user is navigated to http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=Using_The_Pipeline_Tool or http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=Custom_Effects.

_What does happen:_
The page http://www.monogame.net/documentation/?page=Adding_Art_Sounds_and_More seems to be refreshed.

Tested this on Windows 8 using Firefox and Chrome - did the same thing in both browsers.

I also checked the links in <MonoGame root>/Documentation/content_intro.md, and they appear to be pointing to the correct files. Maybe this is a problem on the server end?

data.title: Add XML docs for a few items in GameComponentCollection.
data.body: As mentioned in commit message, I'm not sure if the "Triggers OnComponentRemoved once for each GameComponent removed" part is obvious. Happy to remove it (or other parts) if not needed.

data.title: Reduce Garbage on TouchPanelState.GetState()
data.body:
-Reduce the garbage generated by  TouchPanelState.GetState() 
GetState()  was generating garbage at a constant rate of 12Bytes/Frame.

data.title: SwapChainRenderTarget  leak resources
data.body:
This one leak windowHandle resources. ('User objects' at Task Manager).
After 10000 or so the App crash.

`SharpDX.Utilities.Dispose()` can't be used on `_swapChain`, maybe
remove `readonly` modifier?

data.title: Display orientation can be landscape or portrait on WP8
data.body: Both properties GraphicsDevice.PresentationParameters.DisplayOrientation and TouchPanel.DisplayOrientation always return value Portrait even if we are in landscape mode. Window.CurrentOrientation returns correct value.
